'''Prohibited Interactive Gambling Services''' are gambling services that cannot legally be offered to Australians online. These services are defined under the [[Interactive Gambling Act 2001]] and include various forms of online gambling activities that are restricted to protect consumers and maintain the integrity of the gambling industry in Australia.

== Definition ==
Under section 5 of the [[Interactive Gambling Act 2001]], a 'prohibited interactive gambling service' refers to any gambling service that is provided in the course of carrying on a business and is delivered via the internet to customers physically present in Australia. This includes services such as online casino games, online poker, and certain types of in-play sports betting.

== Prohibited Services ==
The following table outlines the types of interactive gambling services that are prohibited in Australia:

{| class="wikitable"
|-
! Service Type !! Legal Status !! Notes
|-
| Online Casino Games || Prohibited || Includes pokies, roulette, blackjack, baccarat, and craps.
|-
| Online Poker || Prohibited || Player vs player poker games have been prohibited since 2017.
|-
| In-Play Sports Betting (Internet) || Prohibited || In-play betting is only permitted via telephone.
|-
| Interactive Gaming During Live Broadcast || Prohibited || Includes any gaming service offered during a live broadcast.
|}

== Exceptions and Exemptions ==
Certain interactive gambling services may be exempt from prohibition under specific conditions. For example, wagering services on racing and sports events are allowed if they comply with state and territory regulations. Additionally, lotteries and keno games are generally permitted under the Act.
